attributes.action: Allow all parts of the UK to have a say in a Scottish independence referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Since our departure from the EU, it is important than the UK stays together as a single unit. Any future Scottish Independence vote also affects the rest of the UK. The people of England, Wales and Northern Ireland have a right to a say in that future. Why should Scotland alone be allowed to dictate the future of this country. That is undemocratic.
attributes.background: To allow the whole of the UK, including Northern Ireland, a vote in any future Scottish Independence vote.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The decision to leave the Union would be a matter for the people of Scotland based on their consent, rather than by a decision of the people of the other nations of the UK.
